Detailed Description

Class TetrisEngine

Handles all the things that has to do with the gameplay. To make sure that multiple instances of this class could be used at the same time, to for example, create the two-player mode, some things needs to be done outside of the class:

Drawing the background. Event loop. Determine the player's speed. And more.

Definition at line 111 of file Gameplay.h.

void TetrisEngine::setLevel (  long    newLevel ) 
 

Function TetrisEngine::setLevel()

Sets the current level of the game. Used by the outside gameloop to manage which background to display, and internaly to determine which speed to move the m_gameBlock with.

void TetrisEngine::updateGame (    ) 
 

Function TetrisEngine::updateGame()

Handles all every-frame chores such as updating block position, collision detection, fading values and more. Currently uses the global key array declared in TetrisClone.h, might want to replace it with something that is more OO.

long TetrisEngine::m_deltaX [protected]
 

Member variable m_deltaX

Keeps track of where the block is going. -1 = Going left, 0 = Standing still, 1 = Going right. Will allways be either 0, 1, or -1.

Member variable m_deltaY
